channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IA

item.title: Report E-2024010274
item.description:
Report E-2024010274

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-10
  • City: ELDRIDGE
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 10, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3082 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel observed that R+L had placed granular absorbents to all impacted areas. ES began sweeping all absorbents up with hand tools and placed the one (1) leaking 55-gallon drum into one 85-gallon drum . All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum to be staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024010244
item.description:
Report E-2024010244

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-16
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1 gallon of WELD-ON 795 BLUE OR CLEAR was released from a 1-gallon metal pail due to improper loading by terminal ULA. The release impacted the trailer floor. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. (1) 30-gallon DM containing six 1-gallon metal pails of WELD-ON 795 BLUE OR CLEAR and oil dri were created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024010246
item.description:
Report X-2024010246

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-21
  • City: GRIMES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was discovered leaking product during the unloading process. DescribePack: Product escape around the cap somewhere. We could not secure the leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately removed from the work area and isolated to escaping vapors and mitigate contact with the corrosive substance.
